intro: Aragallus varians, commonly known as the variable aragallus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white with a subtle pinkish hue. Aragallus varians is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
